title: How to make type libraries from Windows 10 SDK and DDK?
content:
I want to make type libraries from Windows 10 SDK and DDK version 16299 and/or 17134. I saw this tutorial TILIB - utility to create type libraries for IDA. Then I downloaded it from IDA Support: Download Center and placed it in IDA installation folder i.e. C:\program files\ida. I tried with both SDK and DDK but both failed. Here are the outputs:

```
$>tilib64.exe -c -h"C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17134.0\um\Windows.h" abc.til
Error C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17134.0\um\Windows.h,1: Can't open include file 'winapifamily.h'

```
```
$>tilib64.exe -c -h"C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17134.0\km\wdm.h" abc.til
Error C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17134.0\km\wdm.h,38: #error: Compiler version not supported by Windows DDK

```
Am I doing anything wrong? Should I add other header and lib files? What is the proper way to make a type libraries for Windows 10?

comments.text: You can import Windows SDK/DDK headers into IDA View->Open subviews->Type Libraries, similar question reverseengineering.stackexchange.com/questions/13175/â€¦
The latest version of IDA viz 7.1 does have type libs for ucrt 16299. "FLIRT: vc/vc64: added signatures for ucrt 16299 (Windows 10 Fall Creators Update SDK)"

A quote from readme.txt for tilib: "If your input file uses another header file (e.g. windows.h), you may opt to use the vc6win.til file instead of parsing it again. For that, just use the -b switch and specify vc6win.til as the base til. TILIB will load the contents of the specified file into the memory and parse the input file. All definitions from windows.h, including the preprocessor definitions, will be avaible:  tilib -c -hinput_header_file -bbase_til_file output_til_file"  Or just take the headers and remove anything that tilib complains about.
For the DDK you could try loading ntoskrnl.exe with the pdb. That should give you many types, which you should then be able to export and use while reversing drivers.

answers_data.content:
```
-c     create til-file
-h...  parse .h file
-D...  define a symbol
-I...  list of include directories
-e     ignore errors

```
```
@echo off
cls
set ver=10.0.17134.0
set folder=%ProgramFiles(x86)%\Windows Kits\10\Include\%ver%
E:\IDA70\tilib64.exe -c ^
-Cc1 ^
-D_MSC_VER=1914 ^
-D_MSC_FULL_VER=191426433 ^
-D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0A00 ^
-DNTDDI_VERSION=WDK_NTDDI_VERSION ^
-DWDK_NTDDI_VERSION=NTDDI_WIN10_RS4 ^
-DNTDDI_WIN10_RS4=0x0A000005 ^
-D_WIN32 ^
-D_AMD64_ ^
-D_M_AMD64 ^
-D_inline=inline ^
-D__inline=inline ^
-D__forceinline=inline ^
-Dbool=uint8_t ^
-DSIZE_T=size_t ^
-DPSIZE_T=size_t* ^
-h"%folder%\um\Windows.h" ^
-I"%folder%\cppwinrt\winrt" ^
-I"%folder%\km" ^
-I"%folder%\km\crt" ^
-I"%folder%\shared" ^
-I"%folder%\ucrt" ^
-I"%folder%\um" ^
-I"%folder%\winrt" ^
-e ^
Windows_17134.til

```
```
@echo off
cls
set ver=10.0.17134.0
set folder=%ProgramFiles(x86)%\Windows Kits\10\Include\%ver%
E:\IDA70\tilib64.exe -c ^
-Cc1 ^
-D_MSC_VER=1914 ^
-D_MSC_FULL_VER=191426433 ^
-D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0A00 ^
-DNTDDI_VERSION=WDK_NTDDI_VERSION ^
-DWDK_NTDDI_VERSION=NTDDI_WIN10_RS4 ^
-DNTDDI_WIN10_RS4=0x0A000005 ^
-D_WIN32 ^
-D_AMD64_ ^
-D_M_AMD64 ^
-D_inline=inline ^
-D__inline=inline ^
-D__forceinline=inline ^
-D__volatile=volatile ^
-Dbool=uint8_t ^
-DRC_INVOKED ^
-D_INC_STRING ^
-h"%folder%\km  
tddk.h" ^
-I"%folder%\cppwinrt\winrt" ^
-I"%folder%\km" ^
-I"%folder%\km\crt" ^
-I"%folder%\shared" ^
-I"%folder%\ucrt" ^
-I"%folder%\um" ^
-I"%folder%\winrt" ^
-e ^
ntddk_17134.til

```

comments.text: Also -Cc1 indicates that the compiler id is 1 (visual c++) -- from tilib -C?.
